NEOMYCIN SULFATE

Indications and doses

Bacterial infection in otitis externa,

To the ear

  • For adults
    (consult product literature).
  • For children
    (consult product literature).

Bacterial skin infections,

To the skin

  • For adults
    Apply up to 3 times a day, for short-term use only.
  • For children
    Apply up to 3 times a day, for short-term use only.

Bowel sterilisation before surgery,

By mouth

  • For adults
    1 g every 1 hour for 4 hours, then 1 g every 4 hours for 2–3 days.

Hepatic coma,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Up to 4 g daily in divided doses usually for 5–7 days.

Advice when patient is pregnant

With oral use

There is a risk of auditory or vestibular nerve damage in the infant when aminoglycosides are used in the second and third trimesters of pregnancy.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

With oral use in adults

Absorbed from gastro-intestinal tract in liver disease—increased risk of ototoxicity.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Adjust dose according to individual patient monitoring.

Increased potential for systemic side effects, notably ototoxicity and nephrotoxicity in renal impairment.

Contra indications

Known side effects

Specific side effects

uncommon: rash in adults,

notKnown: local sensitivity, impaired intestinal absorption with steatorrhoea and diarrhoea in adults, increased salivation in adults, sensitisation (cross sensitivity with other aminoglycosides may occur),

Although neomycin is associated with the same side effects as other aminoglycosides it is generally considered too toxic for systemic use and is poorly absorbed after oral administration.

Cautions regarding administration

  • When used by ear: avoid prolonged use in adults
  • With oral use: avoid prolonged use in adults

  • Although neomycin is associated with the same cautions as other aminoglycosides it is generally considered too toxic for systemic use.

  • With topical use in adults:

    If large areas of skin are being treated ototoxicity may be a hazard, particularly in the elderly, and in those with renal impairment.

  • With topical use in children:

    If large areas of skin are being treated ototoxicity may be a hazard in children, particularly in those with renal impairment.

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Renal function should be assessed before starting an aminoglycoside and during treatment.

Auditory and vestibular function should also be monitored during treatment.

Unlicensed use

With topical use in children

Neomycin Cream BPC—no information available.

Conditions when less suitable for prescribing

With topical use

Neomycin sulfate cream is less suitable for prescribing.

Prepared medicinal forms of NEOMYCIN SULFATE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: oral solution, cream,
Tablet
